metadata.dc:author: González Palomino, A
Trinidad Ruíz, G
Pantoja Hernández, C G
Blasco Huelva, A
Pino Rivero, V
Marcos García, M
Guerra Camacho, M
metadata.dc:description: We report the clinic and microbiological findings that were obtained in 10 adult patients admitted by our ENT Service with diagnosis of suppurative bacterial acute parotitis. S. aureus and Streptococcus sp were the most isolated organisms. All the patients were treated by hidratation, endovenous antibiotic therapy sometimes modified according to the antibiogram results, analgesics and antiinflammatories with success. In 3 times it was necessary to drain the purulent collection and in one of them there was a retroauricular abscess secondary to sialoadenitis.
metadata.dc:title: Parotiditis aguda bacteriana supurada en adultos. Hallazgos clínicos y microbiológicos en 10 pacientes ingresados.
[Suppurative bacterial acute parotitis in adults. Clinic and microbiological findings in 10 admitted patients].
